The training rule on receiving almsfood mindfully

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tahaṁ tahaṁ olokentā piṇḍapātaṁ paṭiggaṇhanti, ākirantepi atikkantepi na jānanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū tahaṃ tahaṃ olokentā piṇḍapātam paṭiggaṇhanti ākirante api atikkante api na jānanti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood while looking here and there. They did not know whether the almsbowl was full or not.

analyzed: patta saññī piṇḍapātam paṭiggahessāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will receive almsfood mindfully,’ this is how you should train.”

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca tahaṁ tahaṁ olokento piṇḍapātaṁ paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca tahaṃ tahaṃ olokentaḥ piṇḍapātam paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives almsfood while looking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if it is unintentional, if he is the first offender,
and if he is insane.🔽The eighth training rule is finished.
